title: Manchester United legend Paul Scholes urges Wayne Rooney to resist the financial temptation of the Far East
text:
'CHINA'S NOT THE RIGHT PLACE' Manchester United legend Paul Scholes urges Wayne Rooney to resist the financial temptation of the Far East 
Former midfielder reckons a return to Everton or a switch to the USA would be better for Red Devils skipper BY GARY STONEHOUSE Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PAUL SCHOLES says that China is not the right place for Wayne Rooney, and says a move to the MLS or USA would be better for the Manchester United captain. 
The former Red Devils midfielder was in St Etienne as a pundit for BT Sport ahead of his ex-club’s Europa League second leg clash in France. PA:Press Association Wayne Rooney has been urged to resist the fortunes of the Far East 
Rooney has been linked strongly with a mega-money move to the Chinese Super League in recent days.

And now his old team-mate has offered his view on the potential blockbuster transfer, and he suggested that Rooney should resist the financial offer on the table from the Far East. 
Scholes said: “It does look like he is going to be going somewhere, but I just don’t see China being the right place for him. related stories Why are Man United playing their Europa League tie against Saint Etienne on a Wednesday? “He is a family man and it doesn’t seem the right place for him to go. It is the right played to go financially, obviously, but maybe he will go back to Everton for a couple of years. 
“I think America will be better for him. Do what Steven Gerrard did, do what David Beckham did. The lifestyle will be better over there.” 
When pressed on whether Rooney should leave Old Trafford after finding himself on the bench for most of this season, Scholes suggested any possible exit should be made to ensure regular football for the next couple of years. BT Sport Paul Scholes has urged his former team-mate that a return to Everton or a move to the USA would be more beneficial Getty Images Paul Scholes says that Rooney wil lbe frustrated by his lack of first-team football this season PA:Press Association 4 Could these be the final few days of Wayne Rooneys Manchester United career? 
He added: “I don’t know if he should go, but I think he will want to go. 
“Wayne is a player who wants to play football every week, whether it is a big game or a small game, he wants to play. 
“This will be hurting him at the minute, not being selected for the bigger games. He will get frustrated. I don’t see him hanging about if he is not playing in the big games, but I hope there is a bit of fight left in him.
